text: here's a black man who has a goal of
wanting to be more understanding of
white people's perspectives on race and
he's a genuine goal it's very important
to him to accomplish and what he
discovers in doing the immunity to
change process is at the exact same time
he has a competing commitment which is
to never aid and abet racism and that is
a perfect example of an immune system to
counter commitments or goals that are
working at cross-purposes the more he
seeks to understand what these white
people are saying about race the more a
part of him just rises up and says you
can't do that you're eating and abetting
racism I think it's very easy in any
kind of a difficult situation a topic to
be thinking the problem is with the
other person if the other person would
only you fill in the blank that we would
be having a fine conversation but of
course you know when you're thinking
that about the other person the other
person is thinking the exact same thing
about you right so little paradox there
so if each person could do the work of
taking responsibility for what is their
hand in how difficult conversations are
difficult what what am I contributing
and if you can take a look in an honest
way at you've got other sorts of agendas
that are running you in those
conversations than just thinking you're
having a conversation trying to make a
difference that allows the conversation
to go so much better because now I'm not
blaming you I'm taking responsibility
and stepping into what is really my
piece of it and if you do the same thing
as well well we are in a totally
different position
